intro: Gnaphalium leptorhizum, commonly known as the slender-rooted everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. It is known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
